column5: Hello All,  Spent a few hours casting a line yesterday on the Rideau River. The largemouth are still scattered and not relating to their normal haunts, making fishing a bit of a struggle as of late. Saying that, I did pop a few casting frogs and toads along shallow shoreline areas, and a couple on jigs in heavy cover...  Did come across an interesting sight at one point.  Saw what appeared to be a log sticking slightly out of the water. Worked the boat over, and to my surprise, caught two snapping turtles (and a big guy and gal at that) discovering the birds and bees!  Was really neat to see, and I was able to get within a foot or so from the action.  (At least the big guy was nice enough to let his mate catch her breath every once in a while!   )      Good Fishing,  Justin
Cool pics..Not something too many people have seen I am sure..Hard core porn for sure..

Congrats, Justin - that really is a rare find!  Thanks for posting those pics.  Jeff and I found ourselves smack in the middle of a dragonfly orgy on Saturday.  Nothing shy about these critters - we kept having to shoo them off our rods, hands, feet, etc.
" hey this is a family site...''
NOW that's funny! HAHAHAAH  Very good porn caption there Justin!  yyeeeeeee HD
Hey Tangled,  Great shots of the dragon flies!!! Love that last pic....  Thanks for sharing.  Good Fishing,  Justin
Well thats a different fishing report thats for sure !!!!!
Be interesting to see how many hits this post gets LOL!  Cool pic's guys!
Great pics Justin and Tangle  But I think this thread should be rated PG13 Leechman

Very cool pic,s by all. I watched a couple of small butterfly  doing this thing  last week. At first I thought they were attacking each other,but on further watching,you could see them stop for a quick split sec, then fly off and do it again. This went on for about 15 minutes.
Not what I was hoping for Justin!  Great pics though!    Those are actually Damsel flies Ad.
